Kernel/sources/boot/kernel_init.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00002 /* The purpose of this file is to initialize the kernel into a standard state with virtual memory, a heap, a virtual file system, a IDT and a GDT if necessary. 
00003    Also to initialize any other subsystems such as the timer which may be required for Dawn to function properly
00004 */
00005

00034 #define iprintf(x) if (visual_output) { printf(x); }
00035 
00040 void initializeGdt(int visual_output) 
00041 {
00042    initialize_gdt();
00043    initializeTss();
00044    iprintf("GDT [OK]\n");
00045 }
00046 
00047 /*
00048  @brief IDT = Interrupt descriptor table. Allows interrupt calls to trigger functions int he kernel pointed to by it
00049  @callgraph
00050  */
00051 void initializeIdt(int visual_output) 
00052 {
00053    Initialize_IDT();
00054    iprintf("IDT [OK]\n");
00055 }

00062 void initializeMemoryManagers(struct multiboot* mboot_ptr, MEM_LOC kernel_start, MEM_LOC kernel_end, int visual_output)
00063 {
00064 
00065     kernel_end = kernel_end - kernel_start;
00066 
00067     init_phys_mm(kernel_end);
00068     initializeVirtualMemoryManager(kernel_end);
00069 
00070     map_free_pages(mboot_ptr);
00071 
00072     iprintf("Memory Managers (PMM, VMM) [OK]\n");
00073 }

00079 void initializeRamdisk(MEM_LOC ramdisk_phys_start, MEM_LOC ramdisk_phys_end, fs_node_t * root) 
00080 {
00081 
00082 
00083         /*      
00084         //OLD
00085         MEM_LOC addr = ramdisk_phys_start;
00086 
00087         fs_node_t* initrd = initialize_initrd( addr, "system", init_vfs());
00088 
00089         bindnode_fs(init_vfs() , initrd); 
00090         */
00091 
00092         size_t ramdisk_size = ramdisk_phys_end - ramdisk_phys_start;
00093 
00094         printf("Ramdisk Size: 0x%x bytes\n", ramdisk_size);
00095 
00096         void* ramdisk_new_location = malloc(ramdisk_size);
00097 
00098         MEM_LOC start_mapping_location = ramdisk_phys_start;
00099         MEM_LOC end_mapping_location = ramdisk_phys_end;
00100 
00101         while (start_mapping_location < end_mapping_location)
00102         {
00103                 map(start_mapping_location, start_mapping_location, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00104                 start_mapping_location += PAGE_SIZE;
00105         }
00106 
00107         start_mapping_location = ramdisk_phys_start;
00108         end_mapping_location = ramdisk_phys_end;
00109 
00110         memcpy(ramdisk_new_location, start_mapping_location, ramdisk_size);
00111 
00112         while (end_mapping_location > start_mapping_location)
00113         {
00114                 unmap(end_mapping_location);
00115                 end_mapping_location -= PAGE_SIZE;
00116         }
00117 
00118         printf("Computing consistency check: ");
00119 
00120         struct initial_ramdisk_header* head = ramdisk_new_location;
00121 
00122         unsigned char digest[16];
00123         MEM_LOC DLOC = head;
00124         DLOC += sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header);
00125 
00126         MDData(DLOC, head->ramdisk_size - sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header), digest);
00127 
00128         unsigned int iter = 0;
00129         for (iter = 0; iter < 16; iter++)
00130         {
00131                 printf("%x", digest[iter]);
00132         }
00133 
00134         printf("\n");
00135         
00136         if (MDCompare(head->ramdisk_checksum, digest) == 0)
00137         {
00138                 printf("Error: CHECKSUM Incorrect ");
00139 
00140                 iter = 0;
00141                 for (iter = 0; iter < 16; iter++)
00142                 {
00143                         printf("%x", head->ramdisk_checksum[iter]);
00144                 }
00145 
00146                 printf("\n");
00147 
00148                 MEM_LOC dloc = ramdisk_new_location;
00149                 dloc += head->ramdisk_size - 10;
00150 
00151                 for (iter = 0; iter < 10; iter++)
00152                 {
00153                         unsigned char* byte = dloc;
00154                         printf("%x ", *byte);
00155                         dloc++;
00156                 }
00157                 
00158                 free(ramdisk_new_location);
00159 
00160         }
00161         else
00162         {
00163 
00164                 //Load the ramdisk only of consistancy check is coo
00165                 fs_node_t* initrd = initialize_initrd(ramdisk_new_location, "system", init_vfs());
00166 
00167                 bindnode_fs(init_vfs() , initrd);
00168 
00169         }
00170 }

00178 void initializeKernel(struct multiboot * mboot_ptr, int visual_output, uint32 initial_esp) //visual_output signals whether or not to call printf
00179 {
00180         //Load the archaic GDT 
00181         initializeGdt(visual_output);
00182 
00183         extern void k_end;
00184         MEM_LOC kEndLocation = (POINTER)&k_end;
00185 
00186         //Initialize the PMM and VMM
00187         initializeMemoryManagers(mboot_ptr, KERNEL_START, kEndLocation, visual_output);
00188 
00189         initializeGeneralProtectionFaultHandler();
00190 
00191 
00192         //Move the stack to a nicer location in memory
00193         moveStack(USER_STACK_START, USER_STACK_SIZE, initial_esp);
00194 
00195         //Interrupts description table
00196         initializeIdt(visual_output);
00197 
00198         //Initialize the kernel heap
00199         initializeKernelHeap();
00200 
00201         //Self Explanatory
00202         initializeScreen();
00203 
00204         //System timers
00205         initializeSystemClock();
00206 
00207         //Input interfaces
00208         initializeInputCallbacks();
00209 
00210         //Init the virtual file system
00211         fs_node_t * rootfs = init_vfs();
00212         
00213         //Initialize the devices file system
00214         init_device_fs(init_vfs());
00215 
00216         //Init the kernel terminal //TODO: Improoove terminals, Abstractions cool and all but mine really isn't very good
00217         initializeKernelTerminal();
00218         getTerminalInContext()->f_clear(getTerminalInContext());
00219 
00220         DEBUG_PRINT("KTerm Started\n");
00221 
00222         //Map the kernel stack
00223         int Frames = KERNEL_STACK_SIZE / PAGE_SIZE;
00224 
00225         MEM_LOC iterator;
00226         for (iterator = KERNEL_STACK_START - PAGE_SIZE; iterator >= KERNEL_STACK_START - KERNEL_STACK_SIZE; iterator -= PAGE_SIZE)
00227         {
00228                 MEM_LOC page = allocateFrame();
00229                 map(iterator, page, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER | PAGE_WRITE);
00230         }
00231 
00232         //Initialize the system call interface
00233         kernelInitializeSyscalls();
00234 
00235         //Initialize the devices connected to the system (Abstracted - Uses w/e method to contact devices it pleases)
00236         initializeDevices();
00237 
00238         if (mboot_ptr->mods_count == 1)
00239         { 
00240                 //Load and hook the ramdisk to the root file system
00241                 initializeRamdisk(*((LPOINTER)(mboot_ptr->mods_addr)), *((LPOINTER)(mboot_ptr->mods_addr + 4)), rootfs);
00242         }
00243 
00244         //Initialize the system scheduler
00245         initializeScheduler(initializeKernelProcess());
00246 
00247         print_directory(init_vfs(), 1);
00248 }
